CreateAcl.document: This API is used to add an ACL policy.
CreateAcl.name: Adds ACL policy

CreatePartition.document: This API is used to add a partition in a topic.
CreatePartition.name: Adds partition in topic

CreateTopic.document: This API is used to create a CKafka topic.
CreateTopic.name: Creates topic

CreateTopicIpWhiteList.document: This API is used to create a topic IP allowlist.
CreateTopicIpWhiteList.name: Creates topic IP allowlist

CreateUser.document: This API is used to add a user.
CreateUser.name: Adds user

DeleteAcl.document: This API is used to delete an ACL.
DeleteAcl.name: Deletes ACL

DeleteTopic.document: This API is used to delete a CKafka topic.
DeleteTopic.name: Deletes topic

DeleteTopicIpWhiteList.document: This API is used to delete a topic IP allowlist.
DeleteTopicIpWhiteList.name: Deletes topic IP allowlist

DeleteUser.document: This API is used to delete a user.
DeleteUser.name: Deletes user

DescribeACL.document: This API is used to enumerate ACLs.
DescribeACL.name: Enumerates ACLs

DescribeAppInfo.document: This API is used to query the user list.
DescribeAppInfo.name: Queries user list

DescribeConsumerGroup.document: This API is used to query consumer group information.
DescribeConsumerGroup.name: Queries consumer group information

DescribeGroup.document: This API is used to enumerate consumer groups (simplified).
DescribeGroup.name: Enumerates consumer groups (simplified)

DescribeGroupInfo.document: This API is used to get consumer group information.
DescribeGroupInfo.name: Gets consumer group information

DescribeGroupOffsets.document: This API is used to get the consumer group offset.
DescribeGroupOffsets.name: Gets consumer group offset

DescribeInstanceAttributes.document: This API is used to get instance attributes.
DescribeInstanceAttributes.name: Gets instance attributes

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to get the list of CKafka instances under a user account.
DescribeInstances.name: Gets instance list

DescribeInstancesDetail.document: This API is used to get instance list details under a user account.
DescribeInstancesDetail.name: Gets instance list details

DescribeRoute.document: This API is used to view route information.
DescribeRoute.name: Views route information

DescribeTopic.document:
API domain name: https://ckafka.tencentcloudapi.com
This API is used to get the list of topics in a CKafka instance of a user.
DescribeTopic.name: Gets topic list

DescribeTopicAttributes.document: This API is used to get topic attributes.
DescribeTopicAttributes.name: Gets topic attributes

DescribeTopicDetail.document: This API is used to get topic list details (only for call in the console).
DescribeTopicDetail.name: Gets topic list details

DescribeUser.document: This API is used to query user information.
DescribeUser.name: Queries user information

ModifyGroupOffsets.document: This API is used to set the consumer group (Groups) offset.
ModifyGroupOffsets.name: Sets consumer group (Groups) offset

ModifyInstanceAttributes.document: This API is used to set instance attributes.
ModifyInstanceAttributes.name: Sets instance attributes

ModifyPassword.document: This API is used to change the password.
ModifyPassword.name: Changes password

ModifyTopicAttributes.document: This API is used to modify topic attributes.
ModifyTopicAttributes.name: Sets topic attributes

members.document: ACL resource type. 0: UNKNOWN, 1: ANY, 2: TOPIC, 3: GROUP, 4: CLUSTER, 5: TRANSACTIONAL_ID. Currently, only `TOPIC` is available,
members.name: ResourceType

members.document: Resource name, which is related to `resourceType`. For example, if `resourceType` is `TOPIC`, this field indicates the topic name; if `resourceType` is `GROUP`, this field indicates the group name
members.name: ResourceName

members.document:
User list. The default value is `User:*`, which means that any user can access. The current user can only be one included in the user list
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Principal

members.document:
The default value is `*`, which means that any host can access. Currently, CKafka does not support the host as `*`, but the future product based on the open-source Kafka will directly support this
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Host

members.document: ACL operation mode. 0: UNKNOWN, 1: ANY, 2: ALL, 3: READ, 4: WRITE, 5: CREATE, 6: DELETE, 7: ALTER, 8: DESCRIBE, 9: CLUSTER_ACTION, 10: DESCRIBE_CONFIGS, 11: ALTER_CONFIGS, 12: IDEMPOTEN_WRITE
members.name: Operation

Log cleanup mode. Default value: delete.
delete: logs will be deleted by save time; compact: logs will be compressed by key; compact, delete: logs will be compressed by key and deleted by save time.

Segment rolling duration

members.name: PermissionType

members.document: Resource name, which is related to `resourceType`. For example, if `resourceType` is `TOPIC`, this field indicates the topic name; if `resourceType` is `GROUP`, this field indicates the group name
members.name: ResourceName

members.document: The default value is `*`, which means that any host can access. Currently, CKafka does not support the host as `*`, but the future product based on the open-source Kafka will directly support this
members.name: Host

members.document: The list of users allowed to access the topic. Default: User:*, meaning all users. The current user must be in the user list. Add `User:` before the user name (`User:A` for example).
members.name: Principal

members.document: Topic name string of up to 64 characters, which must begin with a letter and can contain letters, digits, and dashes (`-`)
members.name: TopicName

members.document: Number of partitions, which should be greater than 0
members.name: PartitionNum

members.document: Number of replicas, which cannot be higher than the number of brokers. Maximum value: 3
members.name: ReplicaNum

members.document: IP allowlist switch. 1: enabled, 0: disabled. Default value: 0
members.name: EnableWhiteList

members.document: IP allowlist list for quota limit, which is required if `enableWhileList` is 1
members.name: IpWhiteList

members.document: Log cleanup policy, which is `delete` by default. `delete`: logs will be deleted by save time; `compact`: logs will be compressed by key; `compact, delete`: logs will be compressed by key and deleted by save time.
members.name: CleanUpPolicy

members.document: Topic remarks string of up to 64 characters, which must begin with a letter and can contain letters, digits, and dashes (`-`)
members.name: Note

members.document: Default value: 1
members.name: MinInsyncReplicas

members.document: Whether to allow an unsynced replica to be elected as leader. false: no, true: yes. Default value: false
members.name: UncleanLeaderElectionEnable

members.document: Message retention period in ms, which is optional. The current minimum value is 60,000 ms
members.name: RetentionMs

members.document: Segment rolling duration in ms. The current minimum value is 3,600,000 ms
members.name: SegmentMs

members.document:
Whether the dynamic message retention time configuration is enabled. 0: disabled; 1: enabled
Note: `null` may be returned for this field, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Enable

members.document:
Disk quota threshold (in percentage) for triggering the message retention time change event
Note: `null` may be returned for this field, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DiskQuotaPercentage

members.document:
Percentage by which the message retention time is shortened each time
Note: `null` may be returned for this field, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: StepForwardPercentage

members.document:
Minimum retention time, in minutes
Note: `null` may be returned for this field, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BottomRetention

Filter.document:
Query filter
>Key-value pair filters for conditional filtering queries, such as filter ID, name, and status
> * If there are multiple `Filter`, the relationship among them is logical `AND`.
> * If there are multiple `Values` in the same `Filter`, the relationship among them is logical `OR`.
>

members.document: Field to be filtered.
members.name: Name

members.document: Filter value of field.
members.name: Values

members.document: Group name
members.name: GroupName

members.document: Unique ID generated for consumer in consumer group by coordinator
members.name: MemberId

members.document: `client.id` information by the client consumer SDK
members.name: ClientId

members.document: Generally stores client IP address
members.name: ClientHost

members.document: Stores the information of partition assigned to this consumer
members.name: Assignment

members.document: Error code. 0: success
members.name: ErrorCode

members.document:
Group status description (common valid values: Empty, Stable, Dead):
Dead: the consumer group does not exist
Empty: there are currently no consumer subscriptions in the consumer group
PreparingRebalance: the consumer group is currently in `rebalance` state
CompletingRebalance: the consumer group is currently in `rebalance` state
Stable: each consumer in the consumer group has joined and is in stable state
members.name: State

members.document: The type of protocol selected by the consumer group, which is `consumer` for common consumers. However, some systems use their own protocols; for example, the protocol used by kafka-connect is `connect`. Only with the standard `consumer` protocol can this API get to know the specific assigning method and parse the specific partition assignment
members.name: ProtocolType

members.document: Consumer partition assignment algorithm, such as `range` (which is the default value for the Kafka consumer SDK), `roundrobin`, and `sticky`
members.name: Protocol

members.document: This array contains information only if `state` is `Stable` and `protocol_type` is `consumer`
members.name: Members

members.document: Kafka consumer group
members.name: Group

members.document: Name of assigned topics
members.name: Topic

members.document:
Information of assigned partition
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Partitions

members.document: Topic `partitionId`
members.name: Partition

members.document: Offset position submitted by consumer
members.name: Offset

members.document:
Metadata can be passed in for other purposes when the consumer submits messages. Currently, this parameter is usually an empty string
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Metadata

members.document: Error code
members.name: ErrorCode

members.document: Latest offset of current partition
members.name: LogEndOffset

members.document: Number of unconsumed messages
members.name: Lag

members.name: Topic

Array of partitions in the topic, where each element is a JSON object

Count

members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Kafka consumer group
members.name: Group

members.document: Offset resetting policy. Meanings of the input parameters: 0: equivalent to the `shift-by` parameter, which indicates to shift the offset forward or backward by the value of the `shift`. 1: equivalent to `by-duration`, `to-datetime`, `to-earliest`, or `to-latest`, which indicates to move the offset to the specified timestamp. 2: equivalent to `to-offset`, which indicates to move the offset to the specified offset position
members.name: Strategy

members.document: Indicates the topics to be reset. If this parameter is left empty, all topics will be reset
members.name: Topics

members.document: When `strategy` is 0, this field is required. If it is above zero, the offset will be shifted backward by the value of the `shift`. If it is below zero, the offset will be shifted forward by the value of the `shift`. After a correct reset, the new offset should be (old_offset + shift). Note that if the new offset is smaller than the `earliest` parameter of the partition, it will be set to `earliest`, and if it is greater than the `latest` parameter of the partition, it will be set to `latest`
members.name: Shift

members.document: Unit: ms. When `strategy` is 1, this field is required, where -2 indicates to reset the offset to the initial position, -1 indicates to reset to the latest position (equivalent to emptying), and other values represent the specified time, i.e., the offset of the topic at the specified time will be obtained and then reset. Note that if there is no message at the specified time, the last offset will be obtained
members.name: ShiftTimestamp

members.document: Position of the offset that needs to be reset. When `strategy` is 2, this field is required
members.name: Offset

members.document: List of partitions that need to be reset. If the topics parameter is not specified, reset partitions in the corresponding partition list of all topics. If the topics parameter is specified, reset partitions of the corresponding partition list of the specified topic list.
members.name: Partitions

members.document: Returned result
members.name: Result

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Instance connection method
0: PLAINTEXT (plaintext method, which does not carry user information and is supported for legacy versions and Community Edition)
1: SASL_PLAINTEXT (plaintext method, which authenticates the login through SASL before data start and is supported only for Community Edition)
2: SSL (SSL-encrypted communication, which does not carry user information and is supported for legacy versions and Community Edition)
3: SASL_SSL (SSL-encrypted communication, which authenticates the login through SASL before data start and is supported only for Community Edition)
members.name: AccessType
